sub_title: Team lead mobile bij Triodos Bank
summary:
Michiel has acquired a sound experience as Business Analyst in retail with a recognized expertise in forecasting and scheduling and a focus on Workforce Productivity. This resulted in better work pressure, lower wage costs and better service for his customers. Michiel is also regularly asked to facilitate workshops. Both at customers as in his voluntary work he achieves results in a creative and vigorous way that are being supported by the whole group.

Optimism and energy characterize Michiel. People experience working together with Michiel as very pleasant. Various clients appreciate Michiel for his strong communicational skills, visual way of presenting and high quality of work. His inquisitiveness and sincere interest allow him to build bridges.

Michiel wants to permanently makes his clients better by, beside delivering concrete solutions, also inspire and train them. Michiel has the ambition to solve increasing bigger and complex questions. To achieve this he wants to develop an in-depth market knowledge, learn fitting methods and grow in leadership and commerce.

Projects:
2015: PLUS Retail, business analyse e-Commerce & organisational change

profile_positions.company: Air Miles- Loyalty Management Netherlands B.V.
profile_positions.description: Michiel was in his role as business architect responsible for gathering the current requirements (processes, information and applications) and the requirements for the future situation. He was also responsible for designing the future situation and the approach of the transformation (both in the organisation and the applications).
profile_positions.title: Marketing Automation Consultant

profile_positions.description: Assisted HEMA in their package selection. After that supported them in implementing and rolling out the WFM solution, consisting of T&A, Scheduling and Task Management. Michiel's role was lead consultant for the Scheduling stream. Being responsible for Business Analysis, implementation, testing and technical roll out.
profile_positions.title: Workforce Management Consultant

profile_positions.description: As WFM consultant assisting Foot Locker Europe with their Workforce Management implementation. Playing a role as sparring partner and advisor.
profile_positions.title: Workforce Management Consultant

profile_positions.description: Configuring and rolling out RedPrairie WFM with Praxis DIY. This involves creating conceptual WFM models, configuring RedPrairie WFM, investigate forecasting, setting up training, setting up change management and supporting the business in using RedPrairie WFM.
profile_positions.title: Workforce Management Consultant

profile_positions.description: For the workgroup Treq of Nivon/Nivon Young I'm assessor of travel guides. By observing their actions and insights during training and having an interview with them, I'm responsible for selecting people that are able to guide a holiday for younsters in Europe. Part of that job is making pairs of guides for a specific holiday destination as well.
profile_positions.title: Travel guide assessor

profile_positions.description: Michiel was in his role as functional designer responsible for gathering requirements at the business and writing the functional designs of the application.
profile_positions.title: Functional Designer

volunteer_experiences.description: To improve social cohesion in my neighbourhood so the place where I live can become greener, safer and cleaner I, together with a couple of other neighbours, have organised several festivities for my around 100 neighbours.

As a trainer / facilitator at Nivon I train people mostly in social skills and personal development (leadership, group processes, core competences, etc) and facilitate groups of volunteers and companies.

Treq is a workgroup of Nivon/Nivon Young that organises active holidays for youngsters between 15 and 25. As president I kept an overview of the whole workgroup and the work that was done. Highlights for me were the changing of the name from Knor to Treq and the development of a third training weekend for travel guides. I was closely involved in both.

Guided three trips over a period of four years.
- A two week hiking trip in Donegal, Ireland with youngsters between 19 and 25.
- A two week survival holiday with training in The Netherlands and survivaling in France with youngsters between 15 and 18.
- A two week canoeing holiday in Varmland, Sweden with youngsters between 15 and 18.
